title: Château de Lamarque 2017 Donjon de Lamarque Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. While this wine has considerable oak presence at this stage, it also boasts fine red-berry fruits and acidity. It will be an attractive, fruity wine from 2021.

title: Château la Galiane 2017 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. Soft, with light layers of tannins, this wine is perfumed and full of bright black-currant fruit. It is a fruity wine, likely to mature quickly. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Noaillac 2017 Barrel Sample  (Médoc)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. Rich and packed with tannins, this is a dark wine. It has an important layer of dryness that comes from extraction and gives the wine a bitter edge. The fruit, though, is good and comes though strongly. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Tayac 2017 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. From the northern part of the Margaux appellation, this wine has plenty of generous fruit as well as a smoky character from the wood aging. It will be balanced, stylish and will age relatively quickly. Drink from 2023.

title: Château L'Oiseau 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: From vines in the Entre-deux-Mers region, this ripe wine, with its 80% Merlot, is young with firm tannins that need to soften. It has plenty of ripe berry fruits laced with acidity and a dry core of tannins. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Peyrat-Fourthon 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: Spicy, toasty aromas presage a wine with a considerable element of new wood aging. However, the rich fruit hints at the potential for blackberry flavors. It needs time, so give this wine until 2023.

title: Château Plince 2015  Pomerol
description: There is a good proportion of Cabernet Franc (26%), along with Merlot in this wine, giving the wine a firm backbone as well as spice and red fruits. Despite its alcohol, the wine feels light, bringing out fruitiness and acidity. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Tour Haut-Caussan 2015  Médoc
description: With the windmill in the center of the vineyard, this property is a local landmark. This wine, rich and elegant, is structured with a core of dry tannins from careful, balanced wood aging. Ripe and full of black-currant fruit, it will be ready to drink from 2023.

title: Château Victoria 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: A combination of spice, toast and black-currant fruits gives this wine its future direction and aging potential. It is structured and, with 12 months wood aging, has plenty of dry tannins. The juicy fruit shows through strongly and the wine is likely to be delicious and fruity give time. Drink from 2024.

title: Concannon 2014 Clone 7 Cabernet Sauvignon (Chalk Hill)
description: Tannic and oaky, this is a big, powerful wine with a lot of extraction and density to it. Intense notions of blackberry, black licorice and cedar meet accents of cigar box and pencil, finishing with a robust richness.

title: Concannon 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)
description: Leathery oak dominates in this medium-bodied wine from the mountain appellation. Green, dried herb emphasizes its varietal character, as thick tannins wrap tightly on the palate.

title: Corte Bianca 2011 Satèn Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Made with organically grown Chardonnay, this opens with scents of dried stone fruit, acacia honey, chamomile and toast. The aromas follow through to the foaming palate along with candied lemon slice, vanilla and dried apricot alongside a soft mousse. A bitter walnut note marks the close.

title: Descendant 2014 Syrah (Red Mountain)
description: Aged in older French oak, with a third whole-cluster, this offers aromas of peeled apple skin, black raspberry and black licorice that lead to palate-coating black-fruit flavors that drop off on the finish. There's no mistaking the warm vintage and warm region it comes from.

title: Cave de Turckheim 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: A touch of pear peel is joined by a fresh lemon aroma on the nose. The palate offers a crisp lemon flavor that brightens the light, dry and easy-drinking body. Drink soon.

title: Château Ducluzeau 2015  Listrac-Médoc
description: Firm tannins and ripe fruit give this wine a generous character. With acidity to balance, it offers tannins, forward fruit and an open texture. Not a wine for long aging, this will be ready from 2020.

title: Château Haut Beyzac 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: The high proportion of Cabernet Sauvignon in this wine brings out both tannins and black-currant fruit. It is firm and structured with layers of acidity and judicious wood-aging flavors. It is likely to age well, and should be ready to drink from 2023.

title: Château Laborde 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: Under the same management as Château d'Hanteillan and close to Saint-Estèphe, this estate, split equally between Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, has produced a serious wine in this vintage. Black fruits and ripe tannins are backed by a firm texture and spice from wood. It is a wine to age and to drink from 2024.

title: Allimant-Laugner 2016 Sylvaner (Alsace)
description: The nose offers lemon zest and green pear, two tones that also dominate the light, fresh and dry body which has a pithy textural side. Wonderfully clean and refreshing.

title: Amalie Robert 2013 iPinot Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The name identifies this as the winery's Internet-only cuvée, and it has much the same character as the Uncarved Block Pinot. Rhubarb and tart strawberry fruit, low alcohol, and an overall balance emulate the lighter style of Pinot.

title: Arínzano 2010 La Casona Tempranillo (Pago de Arínzano)
description: Gamy, roasted aromas of berry fruits and black olive are less than stellar for a great year like 2010. A stewed, tomatoey palate is drawing in feel, while this Tempranillo from a single estate in Navarra tastes of olive and herbal black fruits. A severely tannic finish is rough and drying.

title: Binz 2016 Nackenheimer Kabinett Trocken Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: While the nose on this dry Riesling is lavish, marked by plumes of white blossom and grapefruit zest, the palate is surprisingly restrained. Taut with lemon-lime acidity and a firm, steely backbone, it's a refreshing, spry wine with a moderately long finish.

title: Château Simard 2015  Saint-Émilion
description: This attractive, soft wine is fresh and crisp, with lively acidity and a bright aftertaste. It is packed with fruit, rounded and ready to drink from mid-2018.

title: Contadi Castaldi 2013 Satèn Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Yellow wildflower, bread crust and chamomile aromas lead the way. The bright foaming palate offers mature yellow apple, orange rind and toasted walnut alongside a fun lively mousse.

title: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2016 L'arabesque Ad Quadratum White (Alsace)
description: A perfumed cloud of rose petals hovers over the glass and beneath that is a touch of earthiness. The palate is surprisingly light and translucent but utterly rose-scented. This is off-dry but finishes a little short.

title: Domaine Zinck 2016 Portrait Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: A rather neutral nose merely hints at some citrus and pear. The palate is more forthcoming with fresh, lively lemon that frames ripe pear. This is juicy, balanced and refreshing, with a dry and fruity finish. Drink soon.

title: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: A hint of ripe pear can be discerned on the closed nose. The palate is clean and fresh, with just a little texture. This is an easy, light and dry wine. Enjoy soon.

title: Donne Fittipaldi 2015  Bolgheri
description: A blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, this opens with subtle aromas of black-skinned fruit and underbrush. The firm palate offers black plum, vanilla and cocoa alongside velvety tannins.

title: Dr. Hermann 2016 Erdener Treppchen Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Smoke and caramel accent fresh peach, lime and lemon in this sweet-tart kabinett. Light in body and offering a delicate concentration, it's a spry, racy wine with a refreshing finish. Drink now through 2020.

title: Erath 2015 Prince Hill Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Warmly fruity, this is among the most immediately satisfying of the winery's 2015 Pinots. The berry and cherry flavors carry a light streak of cola, and the tight acids bring a hint of orange juice. Drink now through the early 2020s.

title: Fowles Wine 2016 Farm to Table Chardonnay (Victoria)
description: An opulent nose of cabbage, ginger and buttery oak aromas sets up for a palate that is slightly less in your face. It boasts bright acidity but is nevertheless rich and creamy, with a rather large smudge of oak. One for the full-bodied Chard lovers.
